intro: Pycreus melanacme, commonly known as the blackstem pycreus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
